Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) represent an option to provide a bridging technology for energy conversion (coal syngas) as well as a long-term technology (hydrogen from biomass).
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: Whether the fuel is coal syngas or hydrogen from biomass, the effect of impurities on the performance of the anode is a vital question.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: The anode resistivity during SOFC operation with phosphine-contaminated syngas was studied using the in situ Van der Pauw method.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: Commercial anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells (Ni/YSZ composite anodes, YSZ electrolytes) were exposed to a synthetic coal syngas mixture (H(2), H(2)O, CO, and CO(2)) at a constant current and their performance evaluated periodically with electrochemical methods (cyclic voltammetry, impedance spectroscopy, and polarization curves).
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: In one test, after 170 h of phosphine exposure, a significant degradation of cell performance (loss of cell voltage, increase of series resistance and increase of polarization resistance) was evident.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: The rate of voltage loss was 1.4 mV h(-1).
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: The resistivity measurements on Ni/YSZ anode by the in situ Van der Pauvv method showed that there were no significant changes in anode resistivity both under clean syngas and syngas with 10 ppm PH(3).
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: XRD analysis suggested that Ni(5)P(2) and P(2)O(5) are two compounds accumulated on the anode.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: XPS studies provided support for the presence of two phosphorus phases with different oxidation states on the external anode surface.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: Phosphorus, in a positive oxidation state, was observed in the anode active layer.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant

Sentencas: Based on these observations, the effect of 10ppm phosphine impurity (or its reaction products with coal syngas) is assigned to the loss of performance of the Ni/YSZ active layer next to the electrolyte, and not to any changes in the thick Ni/YSZ support layer.
Titulo: In situ Van der Pauw measurements of the Ni/YSZ anode during exposure to syngas with phosphine contaminant
